meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6803.

td.p: Deborah Ellis, a retired middle school teacher from Rogue River, Oregon
Clay Walls, a university honors program manager from Birmingham, Alabama
Nancy Akerman, a science policy fellow from Arlington, Virginia (whose 2-day cash winnings total $14,000)

tr.td: CHEMICAL ELEMENTS IN POETRY
OLYMPIC TRACK & FIELD RECORDS
(Alex: You have to name the event for us.)
PENINSULAS
"MICRO" OR "MACRO"
ARTS
CRAFTS

Clay
Deborah!

PARENTHETICAL SONGS

LET'S GO "C" A PLAY
(Sarah: Mount Rushmore National Memorial--American history alive in stone.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_6_5', 'clue_DJ_6_5_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from Mount Rushmore in South Dakota.) Amazingly, there were no fatalities & only a few minor injuries during the 14 years it took to carve Mount Rushmore, though workers were lowered from the face of the mountain in swing seats, known as these chairs')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from Mount Rushmore in South Dakota.) Amazingly, there were no fatalities & only a few minor injuries during the 14 years it took to carve Mount Rushmore, though workers were lowered from the face of the mountain in swing seats, known as these chairs

tr.td: Nancy
Clay
Deborah!

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Deborah] No, that, too, is incorrect. The correct response, with about $4.5 billion in sales, almost as much as grapes--[*]. [*].)
(Deborah: My second guess.)
(Alex: What did it cost you?)
(Deborah: Too much.)
(Alex: Ohh.)
(Deborah: I know.)
NancyWhat are olives?
$3,800
ClayWhat are plums?
$2,601
Deborah!What are dates?
$8,601
almonds')
